title: Mark Milley
deleted: {{#related:Fall of Kabul (2021)}}Soon after the [[Withdrawal of United States troops from Afghanistan (2020–2021)|withdrawal of U.S. troops from Afghanistan]] started, the [[Taliban]] launched an [[2021 Taliban offensive|offensive against the Afghan government]], quickly advancing in front of a collapsing [[Afghan Armed Forces]];<ref>{{cite news|last1=Robertson|first1=Nic|date=24 June 2021|title=Afghanistan is disintegrating fast as Biden's troop withdrawal continues|publisher=CNN|url=https://edition.cnn.com/2021/06/24/asia/afghanistan-taliban-offensive-intl-cmd/index.html}}</ref> according to a [[United States Intelligence Community|U.S. intelligence]] report, the Afghan government would likely collapse within six months after NATO completes its withdrawal from the country.<ref>{{Cite news|date=June 24, 2021|title=Afghan government could fall within six months of U.S. military withdrawal, new intelligence assessment says|language=en-US|work=[[The Washington Post]]|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/afghan-government-could-fall-within-six-months-of-us-military-withdrawal-new-intelligence-assessment-says/2021/06/24/42375b14-d52c-11eb-baed-4abcfa380a17_story.html|issn=0190-8286}}</ref> On July 21, 2021, Milley reported that half of all districts in [[Afghanistan]] were under Taliban control and that momentum was "sort of" on the side with the Taliban.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Ali|first1=Idrees|last2=Stewart|first2=Phil|date=21 July 2021|title=Half of all Afghan district centers under Taliban control - U.S. general|agency=Reuters|url=https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/half-all-afghan-district-centers-under-taliban-control-us-general-2021-07-21/}}</ref>

title: Mark Milley
added: According to ''Axios'', in mid-2020 Pentagon officials "grew concerned about intelligence they'd seen. It showed the Chinese were consuming their own intelligence that had made them concerned about the possibility of a surprise U.S. strike against China." ''Axios'' reported one anonymous source as stating the Chinese military was getting "a combination of 'wag the dog' conspiracy thinking and bad intel from bad sources." Due to this concern, then Defense Secretary Mark Esper directed his office to reassure China that there was no intention of seeking a confrontation.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Swan|first=Jonathan|title=Inside the crisis surrounding Gen. Mark Milley|url=https://www.axios.com/mark-milley-woodward-trump-crisis-bb8a80b1-3e3a-492b-934a-99825cc6ef7f.html|access-date=2021-09-15|website=Axios|language=en}}</ref>

title: Mark Milley
added: Following the attack Milley ordered an airstrike towards Kabul which resulted to the death of 10 innocent civilian which include 7 children. However Milley refuse to acknowledge the wrongdoing of the attack that result in the death of civilian including children and refuse to apologize for the strike that killed 10 innocent civilian and children which sparked another controversy that resulted Milley being condemned for the attacked.<ref>{{Cite web|date=2021-09-18|title=Mark Milley, US general who stood up to Trump, founders over Kabul strike|url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2021/sep/18/mark-milley-us-general-who-stood-up-to-trump-founders-over-kabul-strike|access-date=2021-09-20|website=the Guardian|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|last=Lubold|first=Nancy A. Youssef and Gordon|date=2021-09-17|title=U.S. Military Acknowledges Kabul Drone Strike Killed 10 Civilians, Including Seven Children|language=en-US|work=Wall Street Journal|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-military-acknowledges-kabul-drone-strike-killed-10-civilians-including-seven-children-11631905653|access-date=2021-09-20|issn=0099-9660}}</ref>

title: Mark Milley
added: Soon after the [[Withdrawal of United States troops from Afghanistan (2020–2021)|withdrawal of U.S. troops from Afghanistan]] started, the [[Taliban]] launched an [[2021 Taliban offensive|offensive against the Afghan government]], quickly advancing in front of a collapsing [[Afghan Armed Forces]];<ref>{{cite news|last1=Robertson|first1=Nic|date=24 June 2021|title=Afghanistan is disintegrating fast as Biden's troop withdrawal continues|publisher=CNN|url=https://edition.cnn.com/2021/06/24/asia/afghanistan-taliban-offensive-intl-cmd/index.html}}</ref> according to a [[United States Intelligence Community|U.S. intelligence]] report, the Afghan government would likely collapse within six months after NATO completes its withdrawal from the country.<ref>{{Cite news|date=June 24, 2021|title=Afghan government could fall within six months of U.S. military withdrawal, new intelligence assessment says|language=en-US|work=[[The Washington Post]]|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/afghan-government-could-fall-within-six-months-of-us-military-withdrawal-new-intelligence-assessment-says/2021/06/24/42375b14-d52c-11eb-baed-4abcfa380a17_story.html|issn=0190-8286}}</ref> On July 21, 2021, Milley reported that half of all districts in [[Afghanistan]] were under Taliban control and that momentum was "sort of" on the side with the Taliban.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Ali|first1=Idrees|last2=Stewart|first2=Phil|date=21 July 2021|title=Half of all Afghan district centers under Taliban control – U.S. general|work=Reuters|url=https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/half-all-afghan-district-centers-under-taliban-control-us-general-2021-07-21/}}</ref>

title: Mark Milley
added: ==== January 8 Pentagon meeting on procedure for launching nuclear weapons ====

title: Mark Milley
deleted: Both calls were by video conference where fifteen people were present, including a State Department representative and notetakers.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.cnn.com/2021/09/15/politics/milley-woodward-china-trump/index.html|title=Pentagon, White House mobilize defense of Milley amid criticism over China calls|first1=Katie Bo |last1=Williams |first2=Jeremy |last2=Herb|work=[[CNN]]|date=September 16, 2021|access-date=September 17, 2021}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.foxnews.com/politics/milley-calls-with-chinese-counterpart-were-not-secret-us-officials |title=Milley calls with Chinese counterpart 'were not secret': US officials|first1=Jennifer|last1=Griffin|last2=Singman |first2=Brooke |date=September 15, 2021|work=[[Fox News]]}}</ref> [[CNN]] reported that Milley consulted with Esper in conducting the October call.<ref>{{Cite web|last=CNN|first=Veronica Stracqualursi|title=Wall Street Journal: Milley defends calls to China during Trump presidency as 'perfectly' within his duties|url=https://www.cnn.com/2021/09/17/politics/mark-milley-defends-china-calls-trump/index.html|access-date=2021-09-18|website=CNN}}</ref> ''[[Politico]]'' reported that a former senior defense official said Milley asked Miller for permission to make the January call, and that Miller said Milley "almost certainly" informed him about making the call, but he did not recall receiving a detailed readout afterwards.<ref name="auto1">{{Cite web|url=https://www.politico.com/news/2021/09/15/claims-that-milley-made-secret-calls-to-chinese-leaders-exaggerated-sources-say-511918|title=Claims that Milley made 'secret' calls to Chinese leaders exaggerated, sources say|website=Politico|first1=Lara|last1=Seligman|first2=Daniel|last2=Lippman|date=September 15, 2021|access-date=September 17, 2021}}</ref> On the same day, he told [[Fox News]] that he did not authorize the call and called for Milley to resign or be fired, stating, "If the reporting in Woodward's book is accurate it represents a disgraceful and unprecedented act of insubordination by the Nation's top military officer."<ref>{{Cite web|last=Singman|first=Brooke|date=2021-09-15|title=Trump acting Defense Secretary Miller says he 'did not' authorize Milley China calls, says he should resign|url=https://www.foxnews.com/politics/trump-acting-defense-sec-miller-says-he-did-not-authorize-milley-china-calls-says-he-should-resign|access-date=2021-09-18|website=Fox News|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Biden has 'great confidence' in Milley after secret actions in Trump's final months |last1=Karl |first1=Jonathan |last2=Gittleson |first2=Ben |publisher=[[ABC News]] |date=15 September 2021 |access-date=15 September 2021 |url= https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/biden-great-confidence-milley-secret-actions-trumps-final/story?id=80040052}}</ref> Two days later he told CNN that "he likely would not have been informed of such routine engagements that either his office or Milley would have had with China" and that he was criticizing the call in October, not the one in January.<ref name=":18"/> At a congressional hearing on September 28, 2021, Milley testified that both calls were coordinated with the staffs of Esper and Miller both before and after they were made.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Horton |first1=Alex |last2=Demirjian |first2=Karoun |last3=Wagner |first3=John |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/general-milley-china-calls/2021/09/28/2b319e44-2099-11ec-8200-5e3fd4c49f5e_story.html |title=Milley defends calls made to his Chinese counterpart, saying they were sanctioned and briefed across the administration |work=[[The Washington Post]] |date=September 28, 2021 |access-date=September 30, 2021}}</ref> ''The Wall Street Journal'' reported Pentagon officials said Miller had been apprised of the call.<ref name="auto4"/> Milley's spokesman stated, "All calls from the Chairman to his counterparts, including those reported, are staffed, coordinated and communicated with the Department of Defense and the interagency."<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/world/us/top-us-generals-calls-with-china-did-not-go-around-civilian-leaders-spokesman-2021-09-15/|title=Biden backs top general Milley after reported 'secret' calls with China|date=September 15, 2021|website=Reuters}}</ref>
